title: Near to Infinite loop when changing Group's name that has API token as Team Member

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

activities.message: Hi @lucenaxpl0it - I'm discussing this submission internally with the HackerOne team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

Hi @0xcain 

Thank you for your reply. No problem, let me know when you have any update on it.

Thanks.

Hi @0xcain - thanks for your report! Although I agree that this is something we should fix, I don't think it has any security implications. For excessive resource consumption, you don't need this bug. The redirect happens in the browser, which means you could also create a loop in a script and access this page over and over again. Our rate limiting should protect us from it bringing us down and this loop doesn't change that. What do you think? Feel free to close this yourself in case you agree. Thanks!

Hi @jobert @0xcain 

Thank you again for your time on this report.

Regarding this statement: `The redirect happens in the browser, which means you could also create a loop in a script and access this page over and over again.` I don't agree because it seems to me that each loop iteration is being stored in your database, and to show you that, I have spent some time creating a script in python to retrieve the groups linked to the API token, and  I got the same large number of repeated groups as response from the API request `https://api.hackerone.com/v1/programs/44544`, that means that it happens in the browser when changing the group name, but every iteration is stored in database.

You can notice that running my script with my test account credential:

```javascript
import requests
import json

url= "https://api.hackerone.com/v1/programs/44544"

headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Basic ████',
}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

convert_to_json = json.loads(response.text)

data = convert_to_json['data']['relationships']['members']
for member in data['data']:
      member = member['attributes']['groups']
      print(member)
```
* Save the above code as `.py` extension;
* Then run the code, `python file_name.py`

You'll get something like the following screenshot:

{F844304}

Video:

███

Thanks
@lucenaxpl0it

Hi @lucenaxpl0it - whoops, my bad, looks like you're absolutely right - thanks for the additional evidence! We'll triage this and get it to an engineering team on our end to investigate and see if this could lead to excessive resource consumption. Thanks!
Wow, that's nice! Thank you once again for taking a look at this, @jobert

Hi team @jobert @0xcain 

I hope you both are fine! I was checking this issue today and seems not reproducible anymore. Have you heard anything from your engineering team?

Thanks,
@lucenaxpl0it

Hi there, I know you are very busy, but I would like to know if you have any updates on this.

Any information is very much appreciated!

Thanks
@lucenaxpl0it
Hi @lucenaxpl0it - this fell through the cracks on our end, we've just assigned this to an engineering squad to fix. We anticipate to have a fix out by next week. Thanks for your patience!
Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!

Hi @lucenaxpl0it - thanks again for bringing this to our attention! We've pushed a fix for this. We'll clean up your groups within the next 24 hours. You shouldn't be able to add API users to the same group multiple times. Can you confirm this? Thanks!

Hi @jobert

I've re-tested it and the issue is not reproducible on my end anymore.

I have created a new API `retest_1` and added it to the group `retest`, then I changed the group name multiple times, in all tests that I did, the application handled the loop iteration correctly, therefore, the fix is working just fine.

Also, I have added the previous group to the new API user, and at this time, even having multiple records in the database for the group `Testing1abc`, the application rendered only one in the UI.

{F908232}

The multiple groups previously created is just showing because you haven't cleaned this up yet, but you mentioned this will be done within 24 hours, so that's ok.

{F908241}

Thank you again for working on this and for the bounty awarded, I really appreciated it!

Hi @lucenaxpl0it, 

We have determined that this issue is now resolved. If you’re still able to reproduce this issue, please let us know and we will investigate further. 

Thanks!
@0xcain
Hi @lucenaxpl0it - to close the loop: the engineering team cleaned up the records. Can you confirm? Thanks!

Hi @jobert 

Sorry for the delay with this. I've checked that now all the records are cleaned up.

Thanks again!
@lucenaxpl0it

Hi @lucenaxpl0it - thanks for confirming! I've redacted your API keys from the report. This report seems good to be disclosed! You can either agree to disclose it immediately or wait 30 days for it to be automatically disclosed. Happy hacking!
Hi @jobert Thanks for redacting that, looks good to disclose it. I appreciate it.
